cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: near the north coast of the Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Bahamas, then forecast to skirt the southeast Florida coast and lift northward along the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Florida coast (around West Palm Beach–Fort Lauderdale area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the east coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. coastal warnings yet (hurricane warnings only for the northwestern Bahamas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and Northwestern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos, then the southeast and east-central Florida Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Outer-band gusts could occasionally reach 25–35 mph, with sustained speeds generally below tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the west-central Florida coast because the storm remains on the Atlantic side of the peninsula
weather_observation.rainfall: Intermittent heavy showers possible Saturday–Sunday with totals generally 1–3 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy bays/seas and dangerous rip currents in the eastern Gulf could briefly disrupt vessel movements.
